definitions.definition: To purge a soluble matter out of something by the action of a percolating fluid .
examples: Heavy rainfall can leach out minerals important for plant growth from the soil.

definitions.definition: To part with soluble constituents by percolation.
examples: The gangue was leached to recover minerals left behind by the original technology.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To purge a soluble matter out of something by the action of a percolating fluid .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To part with soluble constituents by percolation.
( figurative , intransitive ) To bleed ; to seep .
